meanings.definition: To cause or compel (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher garred the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: She garred her dog to fetch the ball by using a treat as a reward.
meanings.sent3: The magician garred the audience to participate in his magic show.
meanings.sent4: The coach garred the team to push themselves harder during practice.
meanings.sent5: The parent garred the child to eat their vegetables by promising dessert afterwards.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel or become guilty
meanings.sent1: The detective garred the suspect into confessing to the crime.
meanings.sent2: Her stern look garred him into admitting his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sad eyes garred her into giving him extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The judge's words garred the defendant to reflect on his actions.
meanings.sent5: The apology garred her into forgiving him for his error.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel uncomfortable or embarrassed
meanings.sent1: His teasing garred her in front of her friends.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected question garred him during the interview.
meanings.sent3: The awkward silence garred everyone at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter garred him as he tried to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The sudden spotlight garred the shy performer on stage.
